prior_works.title: Provable defenses via the convex outer adversarial polytope
prior_works.role: Foundational linear-relaxation (LP/LiRPA) verification that propagates per-neuron linear bounds across layers.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: SDP-CROWN keeps the same linear bound-propagation pipeline introduced here, but augments it with an SDP-derived inter-neuron linear constraint, improving tightness while preserving scalability.

prior_works.title: A Dual Approach to Scalable Verification of Deep Networks
prior_works.authors: Krishnamurthy Dvijotham, Sven Gowal, Robert Stanforth, et al.
prior_works.role: Established the Lagrangian dual perspective that unifies many linear bound-propagation methods and enables efficient backward bound computation.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: SDP-CROWN’s new per-layer coupling parameter and linear constraints can be directly embedded in this dual/LiRPA framework, enabling efficient optimization of the strengthened bounds.

prior_works.title: Towards Fast and Scalable Certified Training of Robust Neural Networks (CROWN-IBP)
prior_works.authors: Huan Zhang, Shiqi Wang, Kaiqi Yang, et al.
prior_works.role: State-of-the-art scalable LiRPA/IBP-style certification and training framework that popularized practical large-scale bound propagation.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: SDP-CROWN is designed to plug into CROWN-IBP-like pipelines, replacing per-neuron relaxations with an SDP-informed inter-neuron bound to substantially tighten certificates at similar cost.

prior_works.title: Semidefinite Relaxations for Certifying Robustness to Adversarial Examples
prior_works.authors: Aditi Raghunathan, Jacob Steinhardt, Percy Liang
prior_works.role: Pioneered SDP relaxations for robustness that capture inter-neuron coupling via second-moment matrices, achieving tight bounds but with cubic complexity.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: SDP-CROWN explicitly derives a linear inter-neuron bound from SDP principles, approximating the coupling benefits of this approach while avoiding SDP’s cubic scaling.

prior_works.title: Safety Verification and Robustness Analysis of Neural Networks via Quadratic Constraints
prior_works.authors: Mahyar Fazlyab, Alexander Robey, Hamed Hassani, Manfred Morari, George J. Pappas
prior_works.role: Introduced IQC/SDP formulations that encode L2-sector constraints and inter-neuron coupling at the layer level.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: SDP-CROWN distills an L2-norm-based, layerwise coupling inequality inspired by these quadratic constraints into a simple linear bound with one extra parameter per layer.

prior_works.title: A Convex Relaxation Barrier to Tight Robustness Verification
prior_works.authors: Hadi Salman, Greg Yang, Jerry Li, Pengchuan Zhang, Huan Zhang, Ilya Razenshteyn, Sébastien Bubeck
prior_works.role: Demonstrated intrinsic gaps of per-neuron LP relaxations and the need for richer coupling information for tight certificates.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: By adding SDP-derived cross-neuron information while staying linear, SDP-CROWN directly addresses a key weakness identified by this barrier result.

prior_works.title: On the Effectiveness of Interval Bound Propagation for Training Verifiably Robust Models
prior_works.authors: Sven Gowal, Krishnamurthy Dvijotham, Robert Stanforth, et al.
prior_works.role: Established IBP as an extremely scalable (though often loose) bound-propagation method for large networks.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: SDP-CROWN preserves the speed and composability of IBP-like propagation while significantly tightening bounds via an L2-based inter-neuron linear constraint.

synthesis_narrative:
SDP-CROWN sits at the intersection of two verification paradigms: scalable linear bound propagation and tight (but costly) semidefinite relaxations. Linear relaxation pipelines such as Wong and Kolter’s convex outer adversarial polytope, Dvijotham et al.’s dual approach, and the CROWN-IBP framework established how per-neuron linear bounds can be propagated efficiently and optimized, enabling certification and even certified training at scale. However, the per-neuron nature of these relaxations—highlighted by the convex relaxation barrier—often misses crucial inter-neuron coupling, leading to loose bounds on challenging networks.

On the other hand, SDP-based methods, notably Raghunathan et al.’s semidefinite relaxations and the IQC/SDP formulations by Fazlyab et al., naturally encode cross-neuron, L2-type coupling through second-moment or quadratic constraints, yielding significantly tighter certificates but with cubic complexity that limits applicability to small models. SDP-CROWN bridges this gap by extracting an L2-norm-based, inter-neuron coupling inequality from the SDP/IQC perspective and translating it into a single additional linear parameter per layer. This preserves the composability and speed of IBP/LiRPA propagation while injecting the key coupling information that SDPs exploit. Theoretically, this yields up to a sqrt(n) tightening over traditional per-neuron bounds; practically, it integrates seamlessly into existing dual/LiRPA frameworks like CROWN-IBP, improving certificates without invoking full SDPs. In short, SDP-CROWN operationalizes SDP tightness within a linear propagation toolkit, overcoming known LP barriers while retaining large-scale efficiency.
